name: The Bradford Inn of Chatham

reviews.text: My daughter and I spent a long weekend at the Bradford Inn and we hope to make it an annual trip! Chatham is the perfect location for visiting all areas of the Cape and the inn's location in downtown Chatham makes it so easy to walk to the shops, beaches, and restaraunts. Kristin was very helpful in helping us to choose the perfect room as well as giving directions and suggestions of what to do. Our bedroom and bathroom were good sized and very clean. The breakfast room was large, bright, and inviting, and the food was plentiful. We can't wait to visit again!
reviews.title: Charming Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Bradford this past weekend and loved it, very comfortable, clean and well-kept. we have been there before and will definitely be back. Wifi worked great. The TV was poor however and should be upgraded to HD. Continental breakfast is a bit bare bones too. Other than that it is highly recomended.
reviews.title: A Great Weekend Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommend. Staff is welcoming & gracious. Rooms are clean & very comfortable. Nice & quiet. A walk to town and the area. it was a very relaxing time. a great get away. You won't be disappointed. We'll be back!
reviews.title: Great Time

reviews.text: The employees of the Bradford Inn are exemplary! The rooms are extremely clean, and there is always plenty of breakfood food for all. Did I mention that the Inn is a good location to walk around Chatham...well, it is!!! My husband and I have stayed at the Inn for the past three First Nights. Guest gathering on New Year's Eve is always great, especially to meet the staff and other guests. I'm sure we will do again this year.
reviews.title: First Nights

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have stayed at the Bradford many times and we love it. We often spend a few days in Chatham around New Year's, as there is a fun First Night program in the town (music, food, and fireworks.) The rooms are large, clean and nicely furnished ... some (all?) with gas fireplaces. A continental breakfast is included, and the staff is quite friendly and helpful. There is a lounge with a fireplace that is a nice place to relax with a drink ... not a noisy bar area. It is a quiet place, even though it is right off of the main street of town. Can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: Our New Year's Get-Away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a four day stay on the Cape at the Bradford Inn. It is off season still and the Inn and the town were fairly quiet. The Inn is a compound of sorts with about 8 building on the property. While this does promote some more privacy than a normal Inn might have, it also reduces some of the charm of staying at a small new England Inn. This is more like a small hotel. The staff were friendly and efficient and the rooms and grounds were well kept. The room we booked had a king size bed , which was nice, but only one chair, which was a bit odd. One of us could sit in a chair , the other had to sit on the bed. When asked about this we were told we could have a room with 2 chairs but it would cost more. So the basic rooms have only one chair. The workout room had 1 treadmill, one elliptical, and one bike and some dumbbells and doesn't open up until 8am, so if your planning on some early morning workouts, your out of luck and with so few machines you'll probably be waiting in line. The outdoor pool was nice looking, we didn't use it this time but water seemed warm and clean. It has free wi fi which worked well during the stay. Breakfast as mentioned by others was quite ordinary, if not disappointing. A few choices of cold cereal, same each day, some fruit, English muffins or toast ,yogurt, coffee cake, orange and cranberry juice, coffee or tea. Very plain spread compared to other Inns we have stayed at, but bearable. I would suggest adding a few bucks to the rooms, if necessary, and add some bagels, muffins, hot cereal etc. It would make a better impression.
reviews.title: A quiet four days...

reviews.text: The Inn is right in town so it is easy to walk to anywhere to shop or eat, the location is great. The rooms were very clean and well kept and other than the small matters mentioned above, overall a nice place to stay in Chatham.
reviews.title: Sharks in the Park

reviews.text: Recently visited Chatham as a getaway gift to my sister for her 60th Birthday. We had fun exploring the north shore along route 6A. We continued all the way out to Provincetown for several hours before overnighting in Chatham. You might wonder about the title of this review. There was a public art display in the town center called "Sharks in the Park". They had over 30 had painted 6 foot wooden sharks on display. Each was uniquely decorated. It was fun to view the various different creative interpretations. We stayed at the Bradford Inn which was a very good choice. Everything you would expect of a charming Nw England Inn. Easy walking into town. Overnight rooms were in several detached buildings which added privacy. Our room was well appointed and well kept up. No hot breakfast, but a generous continental started our day.
reviews.title: Nice Place for a Short Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I travel a lot for work and have stayed in over 50 hotels/Inns this past year. When I was planning my vacation to Cape Cod, I did a lot of research on different properties in search of something "nicer than the usual" from my work travels.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Inn

reviews.text: I will say that when I arrived, I was immediately disappointed with the room I was given. It was nothing more than adequate. I don't know what rooms some of the other folks who gave good reviews stayed in but mine was one with a balcony facing the pool. I was told by the staff that this room, "was one of their finest". For the price, I expected more. It reminded me of a dated Holiday Inn. There is absolutely nothing charming, fancy or luxurious about the room. The bed was stiff, the linens were mediocre, pillows thin, bathroom and furniture dated and the TV was out of date as well.
reviews.title: "A Peaceful Break"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had just one night to spend in Chatham and the Bradford Inn was perfect for us. Great location in the center of town so we could walk everywhere, and close to shops and restaurants. The staff was great and the room lovely and very up to date. We would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Excellent Overnight Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: arrived from boston in the rental mustang for four nights before carrying on to New York, what a joy. the room was absolutely beautiful and very comfortable. the only thing lacking is tea and coffee making facilities in the room but these are available to help yourself at reception.everything was spotless and the continental breakfast was lovely, especially the home made blueberry cake!the hotel is in an excellent position for walking around the town, which is extremely pretty. lots of good restaurants and coffee houses, try the burgers at "the red nun" theyre very good, also "the impudent oyster" is worth a visit if you want to treat yourselves (you will need to book though).would certainly stay here again.
reviews.title: 4 night break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the Bradford Inn early for our eight night stay and we were pleased that our room was available for us to unpack and have time to have a stroll around this lovely town. The room was in the Chatsfield House on the first floor, it was lovely and quiet and we were not disturbed by other guests. It was a large room with two comfy chairs, super king sized bed and a large bathroom. We had a balcony with views out towards Oyster Bay. The room was spotlessly clean and it was serviced daily with clean towels and clean bedding every other day. The breakfast was continental, although on two of the days there was a choice of hot food such as scrambled egggs, bacon, sausages and pancakes although we found the continental breakfast adequate for our needs. We found the staff extremely helpful and friendly and we would certainly stay there again if we holiday again in Chatham. The only thing that we would have preferred would be to have tea and coffee making facilities in our room rather than the complimentary tea and coffee provided in the reception area, this would have been helpful on a morning and bedtime when we like to have a hot drink. However, this wouldn't deter us in any way from staying here again.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay in Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just returned to Scotland with my wife after two weeks in New England,three days of which were spent in Chatham.This was our fifth visit to the area and our second to Chatham.The location of the Bradford Inn is perfect,500 yards from main street and the rooms are large,clean,and extremely comfortable.The staff are a delight and those at reception could not be kinder or more helpfull.Thank you Kristen and to your colleague whose name i did not catch.You made our stay most enjoyable and i would heartily reccommend the Bradford Inn to anyone.
reviews.title: 3 day break in Chatham

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We shall return!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Lovely Cape Get-Away!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Maybe we're just not used to summer prices on the cape - we usually go off-season, but $400 ($385 plus a $15 "facility fee") seems a little pricey for this place. The room was lovely, very large with a tray ceiling and a deck with sunset and distant water views. Everything seemed brand new and was spotlessly clean. A plus - the building we were in was designed so that we had no walls in common with any other rooms. Since we were on the top (second) floor, we never heard a peep from any other guests.
reviews.title: Very nice - a little pricey.

reviews.text: The "continental breakfast" included eggs, sausage and french toast as well as breads and pastries. One quibble, I went to the lobby around 7:30 AM to get some coffee and was told it wouldn't be available until 8. It seems as though coffee should be available a little earlier, especially since there's no coffee facility in the room.
reviews.title: Loved it!!

reviews.text: The location was perfect for exploring Chatham, right off the main street but quiet.
reviews.title: First-rate New England Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The mattress on the king bed was a little soft for our taste, but maybe not for yours.
reviews.title: lovely inn in Chatham
Cape Cod "chill time"
reviews.text: All in all, nothing to complain about, just a little pricey.

aka: The Bradford Inn Of Chatham Hotel Chatham
description: The Bradford is a fine country inn that has truly captured the very essence of Chatham and Cape Cod.Our 38 beautifully appointed rooms & suites set in 9 Cape Cod style houses, arranged village style, sit on a 2 acre park-like setting in the heart of town.
